text.p: The following are the reports carried by Estonia's newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- The NATO sponsored military exercise "Baltic Challenge" at Paldiski had made the Baltic region more secure, President Lennart Meri said, thanking the participants at the final ceremony.
- The government refused residence permits to nine persons who reside in Estonia but are reserve Russian officers.
- Four ships of the Danish Home Guard are visiting Parnu.
- Microsoft has brought to the market an Estonian version of MS Office 97.
- Police have detained one suspect in connection with the murder of actor Sulev Luik.
- A two-year-old girl fell from a fifth story window in Tallinn. She has several fractures but her life is not in danger.
- A customs-free zone at Muuga Port will open on November 1, the government said on Tuesday.
